Identify the animal that doesn't fit the group based on its habitat
The polar bear, penguin, seal, and kangaroo

The animal that doesn't fit the group based on its habitat is the kangaroo. 

The polar bear, penguin, and seal are all typically associated with cold, polar regions. Polar bears and seals are found in the Arctic, while penguins are primarily found in the Southern Hemisphere, particularly in Antarctica. In contrast, kangaroos are native to Australia and are associated with warmer, terrestrial environments.
